thread.title: News of Record for Oct. 16, 2015

title: News of Record for Oct. 16, 2015
text: News of Record for Oct. 16, 2015 News of Record for Oct. 16, 2015 By Baker City Herald October 16, 2015 11:50 am FUNERALS PENDING Donald R. A. DeRoest: Saturday, Oct. 17, 11 a.m. at Gray’s West & Co. Pioneer Chapel, 1500 Dewey Ave., with Pastor Jesse Whitford of the Baker City Christian Church officiating. Peggy Perkins: A celebration of Peggy’s life at 2 p.m. Sunday, Oct. 25, at the Baker City Veterans Memorial Club. Tami’s Pine Valley Funeral Home & Cremation Services is in charge of arrangements. Online condolences may be made at www.tamispinevalleyfuneralhome.com DEATHS Kathleen Friend: 95, of Baker City, died Oct. 15, 2015, at St. Alphonsus Medical Center-Boise. Her graveside service will be at Eternal Hills Cemetery in Klamath Falls. The time and date will be announced. The time and date of a viewing at Gray’s West & Co. Pioneer Chapel in Baker City is pending. POLICE LOG Baker County Sheriff’s Office Arrests, citations THEFT II: Mary Ellen Prevo, 44, of 3025 Resort St., 10:51 a.m. Thursday, in the 2200 block of Resort Street; jailed. CRIMINAL TRESPASSING II: Edward Olan Truitt Sr., 58, of 2185 14th St., 10:53 a.m. Thursday, in the 3300 block of Pocahontas Road, jailed and later released on bail. PROBATION VIOLATION: Ann Marie Bolanos, 35, of 3305½ 14th St., 5:50 p.m. Thursday, on Baker Street near Seventh Street; jailed. PROBATION VIOLATION (Parole and Probation detainer): Cassandra Lee Ann Lopez, 33, of 3325 14th St., 8:05 p.m. Thursday, at his home; jailed.
